issue.title: macOs: "test_bitcoin-qt -platform cocoa" no longer works
issue.body:
As of v0.18.1 I can use `test_bitcoin-qt -platform cocoa` to run GUI tests; this opens and closes a regtest GUI a bunch of times.

As of master (6e4f6553913978fcdddba30e0bb6f97edcb12e80) it seems to ignore the `-platform cocoa` and just run the test as with `minimal`.

As seen on macOS 10.14.6. Git bisect blames a2714a5c69f0b0506689af04c3e785f71ee0915d in #16578 `Do not pass in command line arguments to QApplication` (@achow101, @ryanofsky)

issue.title: Do not pass in command line arguments to QApplication
issue.body:
QApplication takes the command line arguments and parses them itself for some [built in command line arguments](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qapplication.html#QApplication) that it has. We don't want any of those built in arguments, so instead give it dummy arguments.

To test, you can use the `-reverse` option. Without this patch, everything will appear right-to-left; things that were on the left side will be on the right and everything is right aligned.

After this patch, `-reverse` will now give a startup error since we do not support this argument.

events.body: You can use the `QT_QPA_PLATFORM` environment variable to set that instead.
I use `QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland` and it still works just like before
Should this workaround be mentioned in the release notes?

For reference my earlier comment is: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16578#issuecomment-530562989.

I think the easiest fix would be to update the [instructions](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/2324aa1dc409e9496b7083aaef5fcb20849f33c0/src/qt/test/wallettests.cpp#L126-L128) to use environment variables instead of command line arguments.

```sh
QT_QPA_PLATFORM=xcb src/qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt
QT_QPA_PLATFORM=windows src/qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt
QT_QPA_PLATFORM=cocoa src/qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt
```

I think this will just require replacing [`setenv`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/2324aa1dc409e9496b7083aaef5fcb20849f33c0/src/qt/test/test_main.cpp#L66) with:

```c++
if (getenv("QT_QPA_PLATFORM") == nullptr) setenv("QT_QPA_PLATFORM", "minimal", 0);
```
Using `QT_QPA_PLATFORM=cocoa` works for me as well. Changing the instructions (also those printed by the `test_bitcoin-qt` command) seems like a good solution.

Oh, I guess checking `getenv("QT_QPA_PLATFORM") == nullptr` is not necessary because the [`setenv`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/2324aa1dc409e9496b7083aaef5fcb20849f33c0/src/qt/test/test_main.cpp#L66) override argument is 0. This might be needed for the windows [`_putenv_s`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/2324aa1dc409e9496b7083aaef5fcb20849f33c0/src/qt/test/test_main.cpp#L64) call above, though

issue.title: qa: Explain QT_QPA_PLATFORM for gui tests
Replace #16578 with a more specific solution
issue.body:
The change in #16578, although necessary, was over-sweeping.

I was initially in favor of it, but never expected this. It is turning into a boondoggle, with repercussions from our testing process (#17013) to MacOS user experience (#17025, #17179). Even changes outside the GUI code itself (#17184). I feel this is getting out of hand. It creates a lot of work and we'll end up reverting all of this eventually.
